text:
Prince William visits Jaresh Archaeological site in Jordan

The Duchess of Cambridge, 36, has joined Prince William, also 36, on a number of important royal tours such as Canada and India over the years. As part of the royal family, the couple head abroad to promote good relations between countries in the name of the crown as Queen Elizabeth reduces her overseas visits. Yet Prince William headed to Israel and Jordan alone last month in a landmark visit and was the first of any British monarch to do so. Many may not realise that Kate Middleton grew up in Jordan as a child after moving there for a number of years. However, she failed to join her husband on the trip, albeit for an understandable reason.

At the time, Kate Middleton was on maternity leave following the birth of their third child, Prince Louis

At the time, Kate Middleton was on maternity leave following the birth of their third child, Prince Louis. Born on 23 April, the trip occurred just two months afterwards meaning Kate was still recovering with her children. Prince Louis is her third child after Prince George, 4, and Princess Charlotte, 2, none of which joined the overseas tour. This may have been due to the risks the visit carried thanks to political tensions between the regions. According to royal correspondent Rebecca English, the Duke of Cambridge stated they would “have to bring the kids next time”.

Kate Middleton: The royal didn't join Prince William in Israel for the new tour

Kate Middleton: Prince William conducted the tour by himself

Prince William addressed Kate’s absence at the time, telling people in Jordan: “(She is) very sorry she cannot be here with me so soon after the birth of our son Louis, but her family remembers very fondly the almost three years she spent here as a child when her father worked for British Airways in Amman." She spent her childhood in Jordan between the age of two and four after her parents were placed in the region, even learning some of the basic language. Kate attended a local English speaking nurses school in Amman, learning nursery rhymes and songs in Arabic. The young royal family are currently on holiday in Mystique, a Caribbean island. They may be returning to the UK this weekend thanks to the wedding of close friend Charlie van Starubenzee and Daisy Jenks.

Kate Middleton: The 36-year-old was on maternity leave at the time
